item.title: Putin is crushing the last voices of dissent
item.description: The arrest of opposition leader Maxim Kruglov is a blow against the last vestiges of democracy in Russia.

item.description: Chatbots can help patients with their health, when used with caution.

item.description: Trump’s H-1B fee might never go into effect, but much of the damage is already done.

item.description: Readers respond to a recent Post series about fraud in the VA disability benefits system.

item.description: The diplomats’ hour arrived after, and because of, Israel’s response to unprovoked, wanton violence.

item.title: The Nobel Prize finally recognizes what matters most in economics
item.description: Free-market economies have challenges, but they are very good at one thing: innovation.

item.description: Getting rid of the filibuster would spell disaster for Republicans.

item.description: Forging a lasting peace between Israelis and Palestinians requires American leadership.

item.description: Renewed political instability in Tibet could well spiral into the next U.S.-China flash point.

item.title: This is no way for political campaigns to treat their own workers
item.description: Debts run up by Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton made news. But smaller campaigns stiff workers, too.

item.title: As a professor, I’ve seen woke and MAGA censorship. Which is worse?
item.description: Both attacks on free speech are devastating for academia, but in different ways.

item.description: Conversion therapy case shows how lawyers and judges complicate the gender debate.

item.title: Is it America’s fate to decline and fall? Here’s what history says.
item.description: The American experiment will soon turn 250. Is its time running out?
